message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.SI 

The paper discusses a framework for inferring focus areas from passive observations of user actions, which is a key aspect of human-computer interaction and falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques for predicting future events, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The crime map example used in the paper involves information retrieval (cs.IR) and database management (cs.DB) techniques. Finally, the paper discusses the potential for next-generation tools, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
